oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Frank K. Sloan correspondence with Horace J. Traylor, 1966 May 16
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Sloan, Frank K.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Letter from Frank Sloan, regional director of the Office of Economic Opportunity, to Horace Traylor, head of the Chattanooga Community Action Program, informing Traylor that Chattanooga's zoning practices for Headstart facilities appeared to be racially biased and that new zones must be created.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Segregation in education -- Law and legislation; Segregation in education -- Tennessee -- Chattanoo
Chattanooga (Tenn.). Board of Education; United States. District Court (Tennessee: Eastern Division)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Mapp v. Board of Education correspondence, 1965-1967
Chattanooga Board of Education records and correspondence, 1965-1969
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: Raymond B. Witt Chattanooga Public Schools desegregation records
